explanations.A: Not quite. You may have subtracted 1 from 4 to get 3 or looked at the plain flour instead of ground almonds. We need to make sure we are looking at the quantity of ground almonds. What do we divide by to get the amount for 1 person?
explanations.B: The recipe makes enough for 4 people, but we only want enough for 1 person. To get from 4 down to 1, we need to divide by 4. 60g of almonds divided by 4 gives us 15g of ground almonds.
explanations.C: I think you have subtracted 3g because we have subtracted 3 people, but if we need 60g of almonds for 4 people, we can't just need 1g per person. What do we have to divide 4 by to get down to 1?
explanations.D: I think you have found the right scale factor (4), but you have multiplied rather than divided. The recipe gives us the quantities for 4 people. Are we expecting to need more ground almonds for just 1 person?

explanations.A: I think you have subtracted 3g because we have subtracted 3 people, but if we need 90g of sugar for 4 people, we can't just need 1g per person. What do we have to divide 4 by to get down to 1?
explanations.B: I think you have found the right scale factor (4), but you have multiplied rather than divided. The recipe gives us the quantities for 4 people. Are we expecting to need more sugar for just 1 person?
explanations.C: I think you have looked at the quantities of plain flour. Read the question carefully to see what ingredient we are trying to work out.
explanations.D: The recipe makes enough for 4 people, but we only want enough for 1 person. To get from 4 down to 1, we need to divide by 4. 90g of sugar divided by 4 gives us 22.5g of sugar.

explanations.A: To get from 16 gingerbread men down to 1 gingerbread man, we need to divide by 16. This means we have to divide each ingredient by 16 so 110 divided by 16 would give us the amount of butter needed.
explanations.B: If we multiply these together, we will get a larger answer. Are we expecting to need more or less than 110g of butter for just 1 gingerbread man?
explanations.C: 16 divided by 110g works out how many gingerbread men can be made with 1g of butter. This is not quite what we want.
explanations.D: We will need the same proportion of ingredients for each gingerbread man. When we are dealing with proportion, we should only use multiplication and division.
